page.title: 15HOLMESFIELD PARK WOOD (1)
page.content: This ancient wood, south of Totley and reaching to the village of Holmesfield is part of the Shepley Estate.The Deincourts, who came over with William the Conqueror were lords of Holmesfield in 1086 and until the mid_ fifteenth century.Most of their medieval park, where they hunted deer, is contained in this wood.A deep ditch, once surmounted by a stout wooden fence to confine the deer, can still be seen on the northern and eastern boundaries of the wood.On the western side the ditch has been deepened considerably by the use made of it as a cart track and bridleway for centuries.In later times the deer were removed and the park was converted into a coppice wood.Boundary stones dated 1906_10 show that it was used as such until the first world war.Since then the trees have been
